phonux.about:
Unintentionally having the topic of Cyberpunk in an intersection of their minds, <1 and phonux coordinated, tuned and layered these sounds to create a yet unheard version of Dark Ambient Industrial Techno Rock - to name a genre starting point.
The universal presence and transmittability of zeroes and ones provided the field for The Nothing Ones.
More from <1 can be found here:
lessthanone.bandcamp.com
With thanks to Graham
phonux.credits:
released July 12, 2018
Written, recorded and mastered by phonux and <1 in Austria and England

phonux.title: 3 decades late
phonux.about:
Early 1990s, when techno music became really popular, I was more into metal and all sorts of crossover - Faith No More, Pantera, Prong, Senser, Fear Factory etc. I often thought I wanted to combine electronic beats and heavy guitars. Now, decades later, electropunk, techno metal, industrial thrash (or whatever you may call it) aren't really the hype anymore. But... I just make the music I need to make.
Thank you for reading this and for your interest.

phonux.title: 4 (Akhira Tracks)
phonux.about:
Extended individual tracks of the formerly available
longform mix named Akhira Blues
الآخرة
al Akhira
the beyond
das Jenseits
A kind of legacy
This is the last release of the PHXR-series:
PHXR32

phonux.title: A Grey Mind Full of Colors
phonux.about:
Note: Track 3 was replaced by a remastered version on April 15, 2024.
An odd, spiritual, partly melancholic personal collection of melodic guitar improvisations, most of them without background layers.
These pieces cannot be repeated or improved. They are just random, accidental, made without a composition or plan ...but with a heart. In a few cases I added some field sounds later, as a sonic spice. A similar approach can be found on the albums / collections Khitam, Extraterrestrial Blues, n~ Wide and Space Prairie.
Edit: With respect to tracks 1 and 2... I had listened through these in the context of the collections mentioned above, but then put them aside. Those first two pieces are like the paths of life and what they lead us to. At some points (in the process of recording) I thought: What am I doing here, what strange things am I playing? I'll have to find a serious conclusion before getting lost in irrelevance. So, what I want to say: Some sequences are twisted, but I didn't want to cut them out or perform cosmetic surgery.
Recorded 2014 - 17
Thank you for any interest.
PHXR11

phonux.title: Activizer \ Stabilizer
phonux.about:
heavier than the previous one
all in all a mind reset, on a special occasion
release notification:
"Why EPs or even singles? Maybe because a track doesn't find a complementary one? Or 2 tracks don't fit on an album as for now, and there's no such album in sight? Right. Some pieces turn out more unique, at least from an emotional point. The previous single (Summer Hit Hard) is very special to me, for example. So, sometimes I feel tracks shouldn't be squeezed into an album context. As I said, these are mostly emotional things from my side, just like the various names under which the music is released. What can I do? - Thank you for your understanding and for any support, whenever, however. We all need some encouragement from time to time, don't we?
Wish you well,
HD"
Or maybe I should just shut up and play the wordless blues ...

phonux.title: Aerials of Reason
phonux.about:
[Single]
This is from the same session, built on the same drone as 'A Time' (Khitam album). It is a one-take live recording, apologies for some scratching noises from rolling the guitar's volume poti (no volume pedal used here). Please interpret them as 'field noises'. The piece was recorded in 2015 and mastered in 2022. I hope you enjoy it.
Aerials of Reason?
Not much is what it is presented as. Economic and military interests are more important these days than what could be referred to as truth in the broadest sense. If I could, I would spread some reason and good sense. But I'm insignificant. - Take care.

trackinfo.title: Aerials of Reason

phonux.title: Affect Control and Expanse
phonux.about:
I've been pondering on what these pieces actually mean to me, in order to find appropriate titles. They are heavy, or rather weighty ... but in a slower and more meditative way.
The album cover is not intended to indicate any connection with a particular religion. The title is not intended to contradict the well-known passage "If you do not have a change of heart and become like little children ..." At my age I would not want to be as impulsive as children can be.
Maybe I should try to get back to a smoother track, in order to not scare away some ambient lovers with my recent sonic tendencies? Hope you enjoy it nonetheless.

phonux.title: An irreversible Realization
phonux.about: You experience things and they remain somewhere in your memory - at least until you're old (or just done) and lose a lot of it. Some things you'd rather forget sooner. But would that really be the point? You might probably forget what you learned from these too. Your mind works on this and that. Some things get better, others lurk like poison. And the calming perspective of being erased anyway... Longing for that big Nothing, is that it? I'm not so presumptuous as to offer you a therapy. The music-making is just my own one.
phonux.credits:
released May 5, 2025
album cover art based on a photo by Connor McManus

phonux.title: Antiguitar
phonux.about:
A SciFi journey from planned random crackling to drumless prog, with a few funny parts in between.
All sounds and noises have their origin in one take live recording at home with electric guitar and a few effects pedals. No laptop / No software in recording, a bit of editing afterwards, plus: some movie samples from The Wolf Man (1941).
The album intends to cover all kinds of human emotion that can be covered in the span of its running time without hurrying. Even boredom. Yes, from boredom the unexpected intense can arise, like a zombie's hand grabbing out of the peaceful forest ground or a spaceship floating from grey clouds.
Enjoy Antiguitar ...or try another one. In any case, thanks !

phonux.title: By The Sky  [original long version]
phonux.about:
SPACE BLUES DRONE METAL AMBIENT
This album replaces 'By The Sky With Numerous Paths' which was a cut version in 10 shorter parts.
Here you have the full length uncut pieces as they were originally meant to be.
The unusual guitar overdrive on this record is partly due to a dying EL34 power amp tube which had a hidden production fault and produced very individual sounds at the end of its lifetime - that are uniquely documented here. This happens once, the whole equipment setup situation will not be reconstructed or simulated.
Apart from these technical details the music can be a relaxing yet energetic trip through wide grainy spaces ...or just voluminous, melody-traversed background noise for your subconscious.
treesbeyond.bandcamp.com
PHXR02

Make it your own vision.

phonux.title: EchoLife
phonux.about:
Brian May's use of delay in the 1970s was a big inspiration. But it took me a couple years of playing the guitar until I bought my first delay pedal in the late 1980s. Before that our band used borrowed tape echoes for the vocals though - namely an Echolette or the famous Roland Space Echo.
This album is just my spontaneous one-man instrumental interpretation of the Red Special sound. Various setups, various tempi.
Actually the record doesn't contain a lot of delay. Just a bit of BM's typical LR panned thing on tracks 1 and 3. It's more about a small selection of sounds from the BM signature pedal. My personal nostalgia, I was a big Queen fan from age 13 to 19. Then some kind of lightning struck me, and I didn't buy anymore Queen records after The Works.
EchoLife? Yes, the title rather refers to memories, echoes from a crucial corner of the past. I took the photo for the cover art myself.

phonux.title: Encefailure
phonux.about:
Encephalon = brain
Something we have but cannot directly access or control. Our inner diplomats and mediators who try to interact with the brain... Aren't they just employees of the latter?
I will never make such a record again.

phonux.title: Entry 1
phonux.about:
These pieces - in their raw form - were originally released as The Extended Play Journal, Vol. 1. They didn't exactly get much attention, like the whole TEPJ mini series and the Null TM bandcamp page in general these days. ... After a while I thought to myself that I could make more out of the basic, mostly unedited recordings. So I took a new approach and reworked them, added layers. Some material of Vol. 2 and 3 moved to the project Schallther, which is the new playground for all of my instrumental metal and heavy rock *with* drums. (I often prefer drumless instrumental music though. Some call it ambient :) Anyway, it can be said that I spent about 10 times as long on the reworks as on the original TEPJ releases - just to give you an idea. - Please also consider paying a visit to the very much overlooked Null TM bc page.
nulltm.bandcamp.com
And please note: I never remove any supported album. The most that can happen is that - in rare cases - one is switched to private. I would never ever cut you off from an album in your collection. If there are just a few folks, I probably wouldn't see a sufficient reason to make further edits or changes in a record. It's that nagging doubt sometimes, crawling out of some corner and starting to eat me up. The feeling something could have been done better.
Thanks for your attention and help. Means so much to me. H

phonux.title: Gentle Fervor
phonux.about:
I'm not one for trends. I try to reach the maximum of depth that does not yet hurt in a destructive way. It often did though. We can't control or regulate everything. What actually?
Here are two melodic improvisations. And the longer middle track combines musical cultures.

released February 11, 2023
Thank you for the udu recording.

phonux.title: Ghost Town Rage for Peace
phonux.about: You like instrumental guitar music with a touch of western film? Or spaghetti western? I don't like the noodle word in that context, to be honest, so I usually call it Italo Western, which sounds more like an art form. In fact it is prairie rock, with doses of hard rock, metal, dance and... middle eastern? How's that? - You're gonna have a party? Why not put this on? In places it's like rave music. Although, I admit I've never been to a rave, I was more of a rock guy, concerts and such. Long time ago. - So, this record... there are beats, mid-tempo to nearly 170 bpm + electric guitar, no synths. You may dance... or just listen. Thanks for reading this, and have a good time.

phonux.title: Groovar Lx
phonux.about:
I've worked on this album (alongside some other music) since the beginning of 2024. It should become a special one. I thought of it as my last instrumental rock/metal record before moving on to... what actually? Guess I don't know yet.
Half the songs contain dub rock drums from my lovely micro machine, partially sent through a vintage style delay. The other half features electronic drum samples with a tribal tendency. But there are also ambient passages without beats. I could have made 2 shorter albums out of the material... but somehow the variety, the travel-aspect seemed more interesting.

phonux.title: Groove Astronauts
phonux.about:
Note: Track 2 was replaced by a reworked & remastered version
on May 7, 2024.
Music is more than other art forms dependent on the equipment and environment of the 'consumer' (in this case the listener). Different amplifiers, speakers, rooms, volumes provide drastically different listening experiences. Especially in beatless drone ambient music different equipment can create the impression of listening to a whole new piece. Certain frequencies are covered or disappear, others stand out. Headphones are another wide topic for themselves. So, these are technical aspects, not talking about ears, moods etc.
All of that may be one reason why the name Random Fidelity came up. You throw something out into the world, and you don't know how it will reach the recipient.

phonux.title: Growling Dust
phonux.about:
Cruising through the subconscious
Rumbling through the spheres
Different volume > different experience

phonux.title: Heavyretro
phonux.about:
Electro Blues Metal for the Stoner Disco
Analog synth-based drum machine into tube power amp + guitar through tube amp, sounds from 70s rock onwards, slow to funky mid-tempo, heavy (partly downtuned) guitar in between
This is a work of love and the rare, precious, fleeting moments of pure non-darkness and non-lostness. There is a certain underlying melancholy though. How could that not be?

phonux.title: Holz
phonux.about:
RIFF MANTRAS
The trees on the album cover were recently cut. Old high trees. Spruces and some leaf trees. When I recorded these songs they were just about 40 m away from my guitar equipment, near our house. In their memory I changed this album art.
PHXR06

phonux.title: Imaginary Concert #1
phonux.about: In fact almost all of my recordings are live tracks, because there are no overdubs, no layers added afterwards. During the recording process no pre-produced sounds are used and no PC or laptop is on. I usually play one or two loops into my devices just before the realtime playing starts. This is done to adjust the timing and have some components to integrate into the piece. Delays and occasionally a drum machine are synchronized by ear to that initial tempo. Then we go... without a composition, mostly without a plan. I just play and see what's coming to my mind and how it develops. You may ask in what regard the imaginary concert differs from my usual production. Well, I imagined that there is an audience, so I should not overdo certain things and cut them later. For post treatment I limited myself to adjusting levels and some extra reverb.

phonux.title: Imaginary Concert #2
phonux.about:
Slow down prairie meditation
shifting between lighter passages and heavy drone blues

phonux.title: Imaginary Concert #3
phonux.about: Playing guitar without any specific intentions ... (my kind of normal these days) ... After a while it was like playing for a present audience. Stay in real time. That's how it went. It isn't an incredibly long concert, but as it felt like one, I'd like to present it as a part of the imaginary concert series. Making music directly - without computer screens in the first place. And here additionally without corrections (except a few switching clicks) - The intro may serve as a constructive contrast to the main piece.

phonux.title: Khitam
phonux.about:
This is my updated and pared-down-to-the-essentials collection of melodic East ° West improvisations.
It contains 5 pieces from Once Upon A Time In The Mind, 1 piece from The Doors of Perception EP (both discontinued) and 1 new track.
The discography is now brought back into the order of release dates, from The Non Distant Deep ...to Khitam.
Respect and a big Thank You to each and every supporter of my pages. Any supported album will not be removed.
Small tokens can make all the difference.
Khitam = final, ending, seal

1 person played onto 2-track recorder.
Psychoacoustics... here, there ...and everywhere?
Post production of sequences ranges from nearly no treatment to extensive treatment.

phonux.title: Matching Perceptions
phonux.about:
(78 minutes) of self-hypnosis, if you like
Forget about the concept of time?
Is there a choice of perception?
Track 1 and 2 contain slow "beats" that were created on the fly with guitar and fx.
Track 3 is without beats and can be downloaded individually ...in case you don't like the minimalism + subtlety concept of 1 and 2 but find 3 rather decent.
Cover art is derived from a photo of a puzzle I put together ca. 45 years ago.
Yes, it's about time.
And... that's it for Voidwood for a while. There's more to it than meets the eye when passing by. - Thank you for reading this.

Or both at the same time... transcending into the universe while being in a small room. Or the small room explodes into space ...

phonux.title: Neurologie 1 - 7
phonux.about:
Sequences of an audiobiography [ one interpretation ]
This is no uniform album. This is various states and styles.
(1)
Young, drive, hopes, illusions ...death behind the curtain
(2)
Sometimes the sun shines in my heart.
(3)
Devastated, swamped, vampires, pigs and traps
(4)
Space, das Weltall, small particle, big yearning
(5)
"Feed the machine, bastard."
"The machine is crying. I'm sorry, it is..."
(6)
Shores, psychometa
(7)
Relief, (hopes), the final disappointment
And then...
It's done. Thank You.
Neurologie, Teil 1 was originally released on
From Corners Unknown Compilation, Vol. I
fromcornersunknownrecords.bandcamp.com/album/from-corners-unknown-compilation-vol-i-dark-ambient-doom-metal-black-metal-grindcore-drone-hardcore

phonux.title: No Image
phonux.about:
Let go, relax, meditate...
There are other records in this discography for mindjourneys or relaxation. However, they are sometimes mixed in musical styles, with a more dynamic, progressive approach. As simpler structured, mentally slower ones I can point out the two Noname Gitarrist albums (Sound Wellness, Holz) and the Voidwood project. Or Chamber Music, for example.
P Welltone is specifically dedicated to providing sounds for relaxing environment and peaceful mindset.
Intention 1: We are overwhelmed with too much negative, demanding, energy draining imagery these days. This shall be reduced or faded away.
There will be no specific musical genre or style in this project.
But a basic intention.

phonux.title: nomono
phonux.about:
Tribal Space Ambient
plugged acoustic guitar for strings and percussion
different loudness = different experience
Should be a Welltone at moderate volumes.
Otherwise please be careful with the hi mid frequency content !
Initially this was not meant to be released, and it has been a long road for this piece. For sure it is and will remain the most edgy P Welltone.

phonux.title: Now it goes where it belongs

phonux.about:
I record almost all of my pieces without any screen turned on. That has to come later.
Screens are constrictions and create a kind of subliminal stress.

phonux.about:

Re-issue May 22, 2024
improved audio quality and stereo_3D
Parts and details were treated one by one.
I feel the record has come to life now.
Thank you for any support, however, whenever.

phonux.title: Orbital
phonux.about:
Part 2: There are different worlds within these ...if you take the time.
These pieces are not meant to sound enhanced or clear. They could be described as dark, wooly, warm ...slightly unsettling in places - with an imaginative soundtrack quality. Track 1 and 2 are from the no more available Orbits of the Mind album, 3 wasn't released yet.

phonux.title: Otherworld Caravan
phonux.about:
This had been in the pipeline for quite some time. Finally - in the light (or rather darkness) of recent events - I was afraid that the title might come across as almost cynical. No, on the contrary. To me the otherworld is a better place. A place where no dominant individuals with overblown egos can ruin millions and millions of lives.
With this record I think I can conclude my various endeavours to create a coherent album of relaxing, meditative yet groovy instrumental rock. As mostly usual there are no overdubs, only what I played in one go - with the assistance of delay / looper and again drum machines - onto a 2-track device. Plus the necessary treatments (volume adjustments, reverb balance, mastering). I hope you enjoy the music and find some peace in this world.

phonux.title: Outsider Funk
phonux.about: I've never made an album of this specific kind before and will probably never make one again. When I started playing in bands in the early 1980s we had a lot of funky stuff. So it was sort of close to my heart to release just one *instrumental* record in this vein.

phonux.title: P_o_Darkness 24
phonux.about:
2 final reworks of a track that kept me occupied for years
It was originally recorded in February 2015 and named Dark 204 then, with no publication in sight.
Prince of Darkness ?
...or whatever you prefer
Besides other things I thought of John Carpenter's film. But there shouldn't be such limitations in the perception of music. Can the evil have its good? And the good its evil? ... For sure there's light, not just darkness. Some may ask: Where is the Light? Others prefer to stay in the darkness anyway. Or those who are condemned to stay in places they would want to escape.
I hope some will find their own interpretation of this music.

phonux.title: PaceScapes
phonux.about: In places this is rather fast, in other places spacey music. Or both at the same time. It all can be perceived on different levels anyway.

phonux.title: Phonology 1
phonux.about:
Double album - 94 minutes
Recorded and produced in 2021
A fusion and further development of my various projects is intended here.
There are wide soundscapes and also rock elements. I hope there will be a lot more of unexpected styles. I can assure you that it all comes from the heart.
Apart from that: no influence by explanations from my side ...at least not on this platform for now. That would be unnecessary biasing.
Instead I invite you to discover the music within and for yourself.
Thank you all for the support over the past years. Your appreciation means a lot.

phonux.title: Phonology 2
phonux.about:
more beats, some shred ...and melodies
*** A friendly note from your humble musician ***
I enjoyed listening to whole albums since my early youth.
The first song doesn't necessarily always have to be the one and ultimate.
I like to set up records with variations, maybe a few drastic changes and - most important - a kind of emotional story :)

phonux.title: Phonology 3
phonux.about:
Elements of Blues, Metal, Ambient...
+ vintage drum machine

phonux.title: Phonology E
phonux.about:
The album starts out with a rocking italo western track, then moves on to dynamically noisy yet melodic soundscapes with rhythmic elements, dubby blues rock and... Metal. Apologies for using genre terms at all. It's just that it doesn't work without. Choosing generally interpretable tags can be difficult.
Anyway, Phonology is a fusion and further development of my various projects. This record is a conglomerate of contributions by phonux, Trees Beyond, Null TM ...

phonux.title: Phonology F
phonux.about:
An unusual one
No regular guitar
Adapted drum sequences (originally composed and programmed in 2008)
over 150 bpm in places, chillout in other
Heavy sounds, noises, atmospheres, riffs ...
Apart from the beats there's a kind of continuous groove from modulation, analog-style delays etc.
No reverb was used in this whole record. You think there may be a lack of depth? Please listen for yourself. Thank you for your support. Any support is mental support too. Most important. I hope that in return my music has a good effect on your mind.

phonux.title: Phonology H
phonux.about:
The Phonology series includes various names or nonames. In fact it is not about names but about tone and mood research.
The first installment of the series (Aug 2021) was my return to playing guitar and making new music after a 2-year mental block.

phonux.title: Recreational
phonux.about:
(Blues) Raga
isn't about putting things quickly.
It's about getting into a state of mind ...player and listeners.
This may also serve as background or accompanying music.
imaginary landscapes
one guitar
one-takes
no cuts

WE WERE PHONUX

phonux.bandcamp.com/album/a-grey-mind-full-of-colors

kalle.bandcamp.com
With thanks to Kalle (We Were Strangers)

trackinfo.title: Red, with a touch of ... more red

phonux.title: Removed
phonux.about:
Nearly 1 1/2 hours of cosmic doom, with a psychedelic touch in places, some speed riffs, a rather melancholic ending. FINE was on  nulltm.bandcamp.com  as a single for a while. It's only available here now. No one was affected by the transfer.
I say to myself that this is Null TM's farewell album. Maybe I change my mind some time, but at the moment it is like: Aliens have had enough of our planet and prefer to go home. Null TM can be seen as the alien part.
The various guises, different project names are like emotionally different approaches. The music itself doesn't always sound so fundamentally different, I know. Probably because there's a common base of devices, possible setups and mental resources. - Thank you for any support of Null TM, be it on this page here or on his own dedicated page. Your interest and support are and will always remain appreciated.
Another thanks for reading this. Peace ...and sanity

phonux.title: Revision
phonux.about:
re-visualization of things disappeared into the subconscious, brought back to scapes

phonux.title: Satellite Nostalgie

made some years ago

phonux.title: Section [re]
phonux.about:
The album has been extensively enhanced in sound - sequence by sequence - to bring an initially super-lofi recording to best life. I also tried a reduction respectively removal of the noise floor but... that sounded less rich. Noise has its own magic sometimes. The bass track was stripped down to the essentials: bass guitar + effects + 2 amplified speakers (picked up with a portable stereo recorder). No more additional creek sounds in the final sequence, all together just the one-take recording without overdubs.
This music is rhythmically coherent and relaxing, yet full of subtle details and surprises.

phonux.title: Soft Pulse Mind
phonux.about:
Another sound wellness treatment...
In this second P Welltone release the electric guitar is better recognizable and more in the foreground. The piece contains pulses and vibrations in various frequencies - surrounded by melodic fragments.

phonux.title: Soothing Extinction
phonux.about:
Extinction of what? Well, if it were your choice, what or whom would you "remove" ?
There are LoFi artifacts in the intro of the 1st song, nothing wrong with the file :)
Pushing the limits sometimes brings out unexpected lovely details. These pieces have emotional and sonic dynamics, ranging from relax music to fat riffs. No drums in this case.

phonux.title: Sound Wellness
phonux.about:
Music for the Soul
PHXR04

phonux.title: Spontaneous Music Against Maddening Content
phonux.about:
5 different styles of Heavy Rock, and within these again some kind of crossover
"Rock is dead" ...some famous musicians said. For good reason, yet it's a provocatively exaggerated statement. Rock (or Hard Rock or Metal or Grunge, if you will) can no longer be marketed as profitable as it used to be. And nowadays a lot can be tricked and stitched together on any budget computer. Including some of the heaviest or seemingly most underground stuff. Without any ability to play any instrument, if circumstances are like that. Is it what we want? Finally, some artificial intelligence could do the "work". Is that really what we want? Well, I can only speak for myself. My music these days is created in spontaneous live improvisations - with partly analog hardware equipment, old school tube amps etc. Live at home without an audience, so to speak. (Back then we had audiences, but that would be another story no one of you wants to read.) Further production of the "recorded stream" only serves to cut redundant parts and refine the sound. Sometimes I do no edits at all, just a volume adjustment. - Thanks for listening and for any well-meaning. Special thanks to my regular supporters. Your interest might disappear from one day to the other, I still wouldn't forget about your kindness. I'm not doing this for money (except the lots I've spent are occasionally circulating in my head, ha ha). But for given reasons I don't want to just throw out downloads "for free".

phonux.title: Stereomonolith
phonux.about:
slow (tendentially minimalist) metal blues
reduce <> increase
opposites, counterbalance
smooth <> heavy
wide
The shorter pieces 1 and 4 have a few bpm more. I thought I had to pick one of these as featured track, also because of a shorter intro and more accessible buildup. So, the featured track isn't entirely representative of the overall feel of the album, but it takes attention spans into consideration.
And the slowest is yet to come ...

phonux.title: Stereomonolith [ Prequel ]
phonux.about:

good as backgrond music or for conscious listening, floating through the air in between with your own mental sphere

About the subconscious and the conscious, the grounds below, the rooms above, the grounds above, the rooms below, interaction, stillness, movement.
These two pieces are one, nonetheless it's tricky to keep them together - like separate regions of the mind, like different hemispheres.

phonux.title: Terminate the Symbol
phonux.about:
A very diverse record, as was the whole hdsymbol project. Perhaps it's not the best idea to gather too many styles under one and the same name. For me, hdsymbol was intended as a personal fresh approach. However, with album no. 17 it seems to be completed. Here there are more than 90 minutes of... what actually? A heavy rockin' journey through my twisted mind? ...and your mind. A ceremony maybe.
The final, long piece Areas 03 was originally created for another project. Instead I'm including it as a bonus, complementing tracks 1 - 8 in an almost contradictory yet expanding way.

phonux.title: The Mello Flight
phonux.about:
These were the last recordings I made with a completely different setup. I had a soft, vintage instrument sound in mind. This album is approx. 93 % guitars and effects, 7 % field recordings, stones, rattles. Afterwards, since 2015 I focused more on pure, partly heavy guitar sound with tube amp and loadbox. No more rattles, instead I sometimes loop and tweak noises coming from my signal chain.
This is for "whole album listeners", like I've been since my youth, late 70s with Queen, The Police, ELP, Pink Floyd, Zappa and so on.
"The Mello Flight" is from my earlier Ambient / Instrumental days and has a special place in my heart. Though playing was completely improvised, production was anything but a quick shot.
recorded May - September 2014

phonux.title: Trigger Air Move Matter
phonux.about:
Red is the color of blood and is associated with life. It means energy, warmth, passion... but also anger. So much for the choice of the album cover. (As usual, I had several versions.)
Music triggers the air and many other things and makes them vibrate. It also moves our spirits and, at an appropriate volume, the furniture.
Sometimes it's pleasing to listen to music very quietly.
This record has a more profound effect at slightly increased volume. Still, always be careful. Your ears are precious.

phonux.title: Undead from the Forest Graveyard
phonux.about:
These are one-take recordings - as mainly usual. One player, electric guitar, effects boxes, minimal editing. No overdubs and no additional field samples. Rain and other noises come from the memories and minds of the used digital and analog devices.
PHXR09

phonux.title: Where we may come from and where we are
phonux.about:
Over 90 minutes of dynamic space doom
Exploring unconventional setups, non-modeled overdrive / distortion sounds - with melodies in places and atmosphere throughout
It's impossible to choose a featured track that gives an impression of the album. Long pieces have build-ups, and the shorter ones in between are rather like intermezzos. The medium long track has an unusual lot of drums, compared to the others. Conclusion: You can listen to the whole or a big part of the record and experience it how it has turned out to be. Or - as aloof or anti-marketingish as it may sound - you can just leave it and move on to things that are easier to categorize.
To my self-handicapping and without wanting to offend anyone, I do not appreciate sensational or suggestive references in the vein of "black meditation" + some ))) eye-catcher ...just as one example. This music is basically not about illusions, and so far I've never had any profit from the success of others. I'm an idealist, a driven one in a way. Profit is far from me.
(-| )
HD symbol
the [artist] formerly known as phonux ...
and even long before that known as Harry D

phonux.title: Your interpretation 2
phonux.about:
Your interpretation? I didn't want to preset potential listeners with titles, topics or images. It's your decision what this music is about. Use your own imagination.
There's only one track, no long stories, just one mindset... Yours. Tell us, if you feel like it.

phonux.title: Your screen is not the Horizon
phonux.about:
Two special sequences
Many of the trees are cut. It will never be the same again. But that doesn't mean it can't be good in some way.
Thank you for any support of Trees Beyond. Your interest and support are and will always remain appreciated.

phonux.title: Your story is a different one
phonux.about:
RR ... RoaR RetRo Ritual Rock
Instrumental music has more possibilities for interpretation than songs with lyrics. So why should I always set the direction with titles?
Feel what you feel. Dream what you dream.
